title: How To Do Amazon Keyword Research Using Helium 10 | FULL Tutorial!

tactics.name: Helium 10 Magnet Tool
tactics.description: Use Helium 10's Magnet tool to generate keyword lists by inputting a seed keyword and filtering results for relevance and search volume.
steps: Create a Helium 10 account with discount code
Apply minimum search volume filter (e.g., 200 monthly searches)
Manually exclude irrelevant keywords and brand names
caveats: Exclude brand names for listing copy
source_quotes: 'we need to find keywords that meet two criteria: relevant to our product and have good search volume'

tactics.name: Organic Filter
tactics.description: Reduce irrelevant keywords by selecting only organic match types in Helium 10.
steps: Use Magnet tool to gather keywords
Apply 'organic only' filter to narrow results
Save relevant keywords to a list
source_quotes: Select organic only and click apply filter

tactics.name: Competitor ASIN Analysis
tactics.description: Identify relevant keywords by analyzing competitors' ASINs using Cerebro tool.
steps: Enter competitor ASINs into Cerebro tool
Set competitor rank and number of competitors thresholds
source_quotes: Add in ASINs that are very similar to your product

tactics.name: ASIN Rank Filtering
tactics.description: Use Helium 10 to filter keywords by ASIN organic rank thresholds
steps: Set filter to show keywords with 3+ ASINs ranked 1-20
Adjust criteria to 2+ ASINs if results are insufficient
Manually verify keyword relevance and exclude brand names
caveats: Too strict filters may reduce result quantity
source_quotes: if you only added in six asens then you would only want to add two in there
you can be a little bit looser with these criterias

heuristics.name: Search Volume Threshold
heuristics.condition: If keyword search volume is below minimum threshold, filter out
source_quotes: 'add a minimum search volume of 200 monthly searches'

heuristics.name: Volume Filter
heuristics.condition: If keyword search volume is less than 200, penalize

heuristics.name: Competitor Threshold
heuristics.condition: If number of competitors exceeds 1/3 of ASINs entered, flag
source_quotes: Minimum number of competitors around a third of ASINs

heuristics.name: Competitor-Based Keyword Expansion
heuristics.condition: If competitor count threshold is lowered, then keyword results increase
source_quotes: if you drop this down just to two competitors and apply the filters we can see that that gives us 28 keywords

claims.statement: Keyword research enables organic ranking for Amazon products
source_quotes: 'the reason why we do keyword research is to find keywords that we want to gain organic ranking for'

claims.statement: Cerebro tool can generate over 3,500 keywords before filtering.
source_quotes: the tool has spat out almost 3,500 keywords

claims.statement: Using organic only filter reduces results from 160 to 35.
Helium 10 prevents duplicate keywords in lists
source_quotes: Helium 10 won't actually allow you to do that if you try and add a keyword that's already in the list

niche_patterns.description: Prioritize keywords that combine product type, specific use scenarios, and defining attributes for targeted visibility
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Captures both functional and contextual search intent
source_quotes: 'select any keyword that you think is relevant to your product'

niche_patterns.description: Target specific product variations with material and color attributes
source_quotes: find 10 high organically ranked products that are black metal laptop stand

niche_patterns.description: Target specific buyer personas with niche constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines product identity with problem-solving and unique constraints
source_quotes: you can very confidently say that if at least three of those Asin are ranked in the top 20 for a specific keyword then that's going to be a very relevant keyword
